intro: Diasperus angolensis, commonly known as the Angola spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Diasperus angolensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
